Articles.Content:
Hi,

I have lots of add-ons installed (see the list below), maybe too much... and i don't know if it is a good idea too mix them (ex : KSPI with MKS and KPBS ?). I have not tested the DMagic's ones but they seem great too. Should i add them ??

Here is the list currently installed on my computer. It would be great to have two or three lists of mods recommended by the community : is it possible ? does this already exist ?

I hope i was clear despite my approximate english. Thanks to those who will answer.

KSP: 1.3 (Win64) - Unity: 5.4.0p4 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit
000_AT_Utils - 1.4.3
Filter Extensions - 3.0.2
Toolbar - 1.7.14
USI Tools - 0.9.2
B9 Part Switch - 1.8
Community Category Kit - 2.0.1
Community Resource Pack - 0.7.1
CommunityTechTree - 3.1.1
CryoEngines - 0.5
NearFutureSpacecraft - 0.4
Easy Vessel Switch - 1.3
Extraplanetary Launchpads - 5.8
Firespitter - 7.6
GroundConstruction - 1.1.2.2
Interstellar Fuel Switch - 2.6.3
Kerbal Attachment System - 0.6.3
KerbalAtomics - 0.4
Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.1.3
Feline Utility Rover - 0.5.1
Kerbal Inventory System - 1.5
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.6.2
Infernal Robots - 2.0.11
Modular Rocket Systems - 1.13.1
Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.7
NearFutureConstruction - 0.8
NearFutureElectrical - 0.9
NearFutureProps - 0.1
NearFuturePropulsion - 0.9
NearFutureSolar - 0.8.1
Final Frontier - 1.3.1.3103
Kerbal Planetary Base Systems - 1.4.4
PlanetShine - 0.2.5.2
RCS Build Aid - 0.9.1
SpaceY Expanded - 1.3.1
SpaceY Lifters - 1.16
StationPartsExpansion - 0.5
Surface Mounted Stock-Alike Lights for Self-Illumination - 1.4
Kerbal Alarm Clock - 3.8.5
Alternate Resource Panel - 2.9.2
Transfer Window Planner - 1.6.2
TweakScale - 2.3.6
USI Core - 0.4.1
Konstruction - 0.2.1
USI-LS - 0.6.1
MKS - 0.52.1
USI Alcubierre Drive - 0.6.1
Universal Storage - 1.3.0.1
KSP Interstellar Extended - 1.14.4

You can get away with having waaaaay more mods installed than that, and you're using most of the same ones I am. Double check with KSP Interstellar Extended, that seems to be incompatible with a number of mods. As a general rule of thumb, most mods will work together unless they alter the same things, for example, installing two life support mods will almost definitely cause errors. 

You can check for errors in the debug log (mod+F12). Any errors that appear are highlighted in red text. 

Happy modding!
